alert.note: Alert for Coos (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 04 at 12:30PM EDT until July 04 at 4:00PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Gray has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... East Central Coos County in northern New Hampshire... * Until 400 PM EDT. * At 1230 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 2 to 3 inches in 1 hour. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, highways, as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Colebrook, Errol, Dixville, Pittsburg, Stratford, Columbia, Clarksville, Wentworth Location and Stewartstown. This includes the following Rec locations... Dixville Notch State Park and Coleman State Park. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...2-3 INCHES IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
